p: Wind power generation is aggregated using two approaches: (a) aggregation per country neglecting transmission constraints, assuming an unlimited grid within each country; (b) aggregation over the whole European continent, assuming a perfectly interconnected European power system (copperplate). If we find the same results for both cases, we can assume that these results also hold for the intermediate case. The intermediate case is discussed elsewhere [ 50, 51] for current climatic conditions and in Wohland et al. [ 52] for a changing climate but without considering storage.
